items.title: DK Metcalf's third touchdown gives Seahawks 35-27 lead
items.content_text: Cowboys cornerback DaRon Bland had a tough time handling DK Metcalf in the first half, so Dan Quinn started having Stephon Gilmore travel with the Seahawks receiver in the second half.

items.title: Ohio reports more than $746M in wagers placed on sports in October
OU advances to 7-0 in 1st game at McCasland Field House since 2012
items.content_text: Oklahoma (7-0) defeated Arkansas-Pine Bluff (4-3) 107-86 on Tuesday at McCasland Field House in Norman.
items.content_html: Oklahoma (7-0) defeated Arkansas-Pine Bluff (4-3) 107-86 on Tuesday at McCasland Field House in Norman.

items.title: Sports Person of the Week
items.content_text: Bailey Tillman has been a foundational piece for the growth of McNeese University’s volleyball program as the Junior Libero has racked up awards that no Cowgirls player has ever won before.
items.content_html: Bailey Tillman has been a foundational piece for the growth of McNeese University’s volleyball program as the Junior Libero has racked up awards that no Cowgirls player has ever won before.

items.title: Tyreek Hill will cover pay for photographer suspended by NFL
items.content_text: Dolphins receiver Tyreek Hill said Thursday he will pay the salary of the photographer who had his sideline credential suspended by the NFL.

items.title: Sports and its coverage keep spiraling to new lows
items.content_text: I’m trying to change my tune, to shed this old and grumpy act. But that would mean joining the con job legion, targeting the lowest common denominator as the only one sports now target.

items.title: Mark Cuban’s Mavs sale could be the nail in the coffin for Bally Sports in Dallas
items.content_text: After Mark Cuban sold a majority stake of the Dallas Mavericks to a Las Vegas casino family, Bally's future with the team looks to be coming to an end soon.

items.title: Panthers get defensive in hoops win over Bucs
items.content_text: BLUE EARTH— The Blue Earth Area Bucs girls basketball team had their hands full Thursday night with the visiting New Richland-Hartland-Ellendale-Geneva Panthers in Blue Earth. The Panthers came out on top 60-40 in a nonconference game they seemed to control from the jump. It was NRHEG senior Preslie Nielsen who got things going during the […]

items.title: Minnesota DNR shares reminders about the upcoming snowmobile riding season
items.content_text: Information courtesy of MInnesota DNR As the snowmobile riding season draws near, the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources reminds riders of important dates, safety tips and registration requirements. The current lack of snow cover means that Minnesota’s snowmobile trails will not be usable by the official opening date of Dec. 1. Several conditions must be […]

items.title: Houghton shoots past Ewen-Trout Creek, 62-48
items.content_text: HOUGHTON — It seemingly took just one game to work out the opening-season jitters for the Houghton Gremlins boys basketball team. On Monday, the Gremlins (1-1) struggled to hit shots in their opener against the Jeffers Jets, losing 57-47. After a strong practice on Tuesday, Gremlins coach Jared Lawson made some adjustments, and his squad […]

items.title: Waterford erases early deficit, beats Eastern 52-31
items.content_text: WATERFORD – Spotting a team eight points wasn’t in the gameplan for the Waterford girls basketball season-opener on Thursday night. Yet, the Wildcats put a stop to Eastern’s momentum three minutes into the contest and played with a purpose the rest of the game and defeated the Eagles, 52-31. “We just didn’t cover – I […]

items.title: St. James returns to Tomahawk East League
items.content_text: ST. JAMES — After a five-year absence from the Tomahawk East League, St. James is back for the upcoming baseball season. “We (Tomahawk East League) accepted them unanimously Wednesday night at our league meeting,” TEL president Myron Seidl said. St.James last played in the TEL in 2018. “They had six people come to our meeting […]

items.title: Bellaire falls to Linsly Cadets
items.content_text: BROOKE — Playing in their first game of the season, the Linsly Cadets hardly had an opportunity to dip their toes in the water of the new year. items.title: Patricia Jo McClellan
items.content_text: Patricia Jo McClellan, 68, of Altoona, went to be with her son, Jason, after a sudden stroke. She is survived by the love of her life and future husband, Mike Johnson. Patty had many brothers and sisters: Jeff (Diana) McConnell, Kenny (Nancy) McPherson, Betty (Richard) Shingler, John (Sandy) McClellan, David (Patty) Wendle, Sharon Lechner, Eddy […]

items.title: Ferry girls bounce Back with a win over St. C.
items.content_text: ST. CLAIRSVILLE — After falling flat on its face in a season-opening setback at Marietta on Tuesday night, Martins Ferry took its frustrations out on St. Clairsville on Thursday night. The Purple Riders (1-1) started strong and never relented in a 55-25 pounding of the mistake-prone Red Red Devils on John Jenkins Court inside St. […]
